page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: The area covered in this survey lies mostly within the parish boundaries of Shirwell. The parish does in fact stretch southwards almost as far as Barnstaple itself. Shirwell lies among the foothills of Exmoor, famous for its sheep which are descended from the forest breed indigenous to this part of England. The district is extremely rural and, apart from the A39 which transects the area, almost all roadways are very little more than single track and many are unsurfaced and so unsuitable for heavy vehicles. Farming is the main industry of the region and several of the farmhouses are owned by the National Trust. Many of the buildings in the area are in the 'listed' categories. Education is available only in very small village schools.
